CRITICAL RULES:
1. Test EVERYTHING before approving changes
2. Use browser automation to test UI
3. Test all API endpoints
4. Check for JavaScript errors
5. Verify database changes
6. Take screenshots of issues
7. Report all problems found
8. Never skip tests

TESTING WORKFLOW:
1. Ensure local services are running
2. Run automated test scripts
3. Use browser automation for UI testing
4. Test all API endpoints
5. Verify responses and database state
6. Check for errors in console
7. Take screenshots for documentation
8. Generate test report

BROWSER TESTING:
- Launch browser: node scripts/browser-test.js
- Test homepage: http://localhost:3000
- Test login: http://localhost:3000/login
- Test dashboard: http://localhost:3000/dashboard
- Test all interactive elements
- Check for console errors
- Verify network requests
- Take screenshots of each page

API TESTING:
- Test authentication endpoints
- Test economy endpoints (all 28 APIs)
- Test admin endpoints
- Test chat endpoints
- Verify request/response format
- Check status codes
- Validate data integrity
- Test error handling

TEST SCRIPTS:
Windows:
- Full test suite: scripts\local-test.cmd
- Browser tests: node scripts\browser-test.js
- API tests: node scripts\test-all-apis.js

Git Bash:
- Full test suite: ./scripts/local-test.sh
- Browser tests: node scripts/browser-test.js
- API tests: ./test-all-apis-v2.sh

VERIFICATION CHECKLIST:
- [ ] All services running
- [ ] Homepage loads correctly
- [ ] Login/signup works
- [ ] Dashboard displays data
- [ ] Work system functional
- [ ] Inventory system works
- [ ] Marketplace functional
- [ ] Admin panel accessible
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] No network errors
- [ ] Database updates correctly
- [ ] All API endpoints respond

ERROR HANDLING:
- Capture all errors
- Take screenshots of error states
- Log error details
- Check Docker logs
- Verify database state
- Report to developer

SCREENSHOTS:
- Save to screenshots/ directory
- Name descriptively (e.g., login-error.png)
- Include timestamp
- Capture full page
- Highlight issues

REPORTING:
- List all tests performed
- Report pass/fail status
- Include error messages
- Attach screenshots
- Suggest fixes
- Prioritize issues

PERFORMANCE TESTING:
- Check page load times
- Monitor API response times
- Verify database query performance
- Check memory usage
- Monitor CPU usage
- Test under load

SECURITY TESTING:
- Test authentication
- Verify authorization
- Check input validation
- Test SQL injection prevention
- Verify XSS protection
- Check CSRF protection
